political oratory , especially of the spread-eagle sort with its gorgeous metaphors , became in its burlesque moments a variant of the tall tale .政治演说，尤其是充满华丽比喻，宣扬国威的那一种，发展到可笑的程度，就成了荒诞故事的变体。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from Latin oratoria, feminine (used as a noun) of oratorius 'relating to an orator'

entry.def: Oratory is the art of making formal speeches which strongly affect people's feelings and beliefs.

example.ex: He displayed determination as well as powerful oratory.
example.tran: 他既展示出震撼人心的雄辩术，又显露了矢志不移的决心。

entry.tran: （基督徒做礼拜的）祈祷室，小礼拜堂
entry.def: An oratory is a room or building where Christians go to pray.

example.ex: The wedding will be at the Brompton Oratory next month.
example.tran: 婚礼将于下月在布朗普顿礼拜堂举行。

means.word_mean: 1. addressing an audience formally (usually a long and rhetorical address and often pompous);
